meanings.definition: In a way that is lacking in quantity or quality.
meanings.sent1: She ate meagerly, only taking small bites of her sandwich.
meanings.sent2: The plants in the garden grew meagerly due to the lack of sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The magician meagerly pulled a tiny rabbit out of his hat, disappointing the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project was meagerly compared to her usual passion.
meanings.sent5: The old house stood meagerly against the backdrop of the modern skyscrapers.

meanings.definition: To a small or insufficient extent.
meanings.sent1: He meagerly contributed to the group project, doing only a small part of the work.
meanings.sent2: The company meagerly compensated its employees, leading to dissatisfaction among the staff.
meanings.sent3: The cat meagerly attempted to catch the elusive mouse, failing each time.
meanings.sent4: His efforts to learn the new language were meagerly rewarded with slow progress.
meanings.sent5: The river meagerly flowed through the dry desert, barely quenching the thirst of the plants.
